eu.mondo.mondix.core

Interface IQueryInstance

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    ILiveQueryInstance, ILiveQueryInstanceDirect<Row>, INullaryQueryInstance, IQueryInstanceDirect<Row>, IUnaryQueryInstance
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    LiveNullaryQueryInstance, LiveQueryInstance, LiveUnaryQueryInstance, MondixNullaryQueryInstance, MondixQueryInstance, MondixUnaryQueryInstance

    public interface IQueryInstance
    A query with potential parameter substitutions (seed).

    The query results are obtained from a base relation by seeding it with a query.

    See also interface extensions IUnaryQueryInstance, INullaryQueryInstance, IQueryInstanceDirect

    Author:
    Bergmann Gabor

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void dispose()
      Indicate that this query instance will no longer be needed, and any supporting index structures can be disposed unless used elsewhere.
      java.lang.Iterable<? extends java.util.List<?>> getAllTuples()
      Core functionality: returns all tuples formed by selected columns of the base relation that are in the result set of this (filtered) query instance.
      IMondixRelation getBaseRelation()
      The base relation which is seeded by this query instance.
      int getCountOfTuples()
      Core functionality: returns the number of tuples of the base relation that are in the result set of this (seeded) query instance.
      java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getFilter()
      Returns the filter applied by this query.
      java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSelectedColumnNames()
      Returns the list of column names that are selected from the original base relation.

    • Method Detail

      • getBaseRelation

        IMondixRelation getBaseRelation()
        The base relation which is seeded by this query instance.

      • getSelectedColumnNames

        java.util.List<java.lang.String> getSelectedColumnNames()
        Returns the list of column names that are selected from the original base relation.
        Returns:
        the ordered, unique list of columns that should be returned for tuples in this relation (can be empty).

      • getFilter

        java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getFilter()
        Returns the filter applied by this query.

        The query is filtered to those tuples only that take the given values at the given columns.

        Returns:
        a map from zero or more column names to concrete values.

      • dispose

        void dispose()
        Indicate that this query instance will no longer be needed, and any supporting index structures can be disposed unless used elsewhere.

      • getCountOfTuples

        int getCountOfTuples()
        Core functionality: returns the number of tuples of the base relation that are in the result set of this (seeded) query instance.

      • getAllTuples

        java.lang.Iterable<? extends java.util.List<?>> getAllTuples()
        Core functionality: returns all tuples formed by selected columns of the base relation that are in the result set of this (filtered) query instance.

        Each tuple will be returned as a list of values, one for each selected columns (see getSelectedColumnNames()).

        Returned tuples must be distinct.

        Invoking this method may involve copying the indexer contents into such a list-based row format. This copying is necessary for cross-network transfer anyway; more efficient solutions may be available for local clients if the IQueryInstanceDirect interface extension is provided.
